abstract: Lear, the auto-parts maker, said Friday it agreed to be acquired by American Real Estate Partners, the investment firm controlled by Carl C. Icahn, for $36 per share, or about $5.3 billion including the assumption of debt. The offer, which was announced Monday, is being opposed by one of Lear’s major shareholders.

headline.main: Lear Agrees to Buyout by Icahn’s Firm
